holidays.name: Science Fiction Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate imaginative worlds, futuristic technology, and the creative minds that explore the possibilities of tomorrow through science fiction.
holidays.origin: Celebrated on the birthday of famed sci-fi author Isaac Asimov (January 2, 1920).
holidays.funFact: Isaac Asimov wrote or edited over 500 books during his lifetime, shaping much of modern science fiction.

holidays.name: Motivation and Inspiration Day
holidays.description: Kickstart your year by finding motivation and inspiration to achieve your goals and dreams!
holidays.origin: An unofficial day recognized by motivational speakers and self-help communities to inspire positivity early in the new year.
holidays.funFact: Many people set New Year's resolutions on January 1, but January 2 helps keep motivation alive after the initial excitement passes.

holidays.name: Crepe Day
holidays.description: A delightful day to enjoy crepes ‚Äî thin French pancakes that can be filled with everything from chocolate to cheese!
holidays.origin: Unofficial food holiday inspired by French culinary tradition celebrating crepes.
holidays.funFact: In France, crepes are so beloved that February 2nd is also celebrated as 'La Chandeleur' or Crepe Day, but January 2 offers an early winter treat!
